primary: Could you make that two, please?
similar: Can I get another one of those?
example:
A: I'll have the spicy margarita, please.
B: That's a great choice. And for you, sir?
C: Actually, could you make that two, please?
B: You got it. Two spicy margaritas coming right up.
A: Good call, these are the best in the city.
C: I was thinking the same thing after the first sip.
japanese: 私（わたし）も同（おな）じので
chinese: 请再来一份一样的 (Qǐng zàilái yí fèn yíyàng de) / 给我来个双份 (Gěi wǒ lái gè shuāngfèn)
spanish: ¿Me das dos, por favor? / Que sean dos, por favor.
vietnamese: Cho tôi một phần y hệt vậy nữa / Lấy thêm một cái nữa nhé

example:
A: I wonder where Tim is, he's always late.
B: Yo, speak of the devil! Here he comes now.
C: Sorry guys, the subway was buggin'.
A: We were literally just talking about you.
B: Hilarious timing.
C: My ears were ringing, for real.
chinese: 说曹操曹操到！ (Shuō Cáocāo Cáocāo dào!)
spanish: ¡Hablando del rey de Roma! / ¡Mira quién llegó!
vietnamese: Vừa nhắc Tào Tháo là Tào Tháo tới / Thiêng thật đấy
